Investing in PPF? Don’t exceed Rs 1.5L limit; interest on excess will be taken back!
description: New rules now link PPF investments to PAN, making it impossible to hide multiple accounts. Exceeding the Rs 1.5 lakh annual limit can lead to interest clawback on excess contributions.  Irregular accounts won't earn interest, with minor accounts earning a mere 4% until regularized.

IND vs SA: Smriti Mandhana shatters record! Closes in on 5000 runs
description: Smriti Mandhana has become the highest run-getter in women's ODIs in a single calendar year, surpassing Belinda Clark's 28-year-old record. She achieved this milestone during India's World Cup clash against South Africa, amassing 982 runs in 17 matches this year. Mandhana's exceptional form continues to redefine consistency in women's ODI cricket.

title: Nobel claim: Sorry Trump, even AI isn't buying it
description: AI chatbots, including ChatGPT, Gemini, and Grok, have largely dismissed Donald Trump's claim of deserving a Nobel Peace Prize for ending seven wars. Experts and the AI models found his assertions disputed, vague, or exaggerated, highlighting a lack of solid evidence for truly ending conflicts. While acknowledging some de-escalatory efforts, they deem them insufficient for the prestigious award.

description: Prithvi Shaw scored 181 in a practice match. The innings saw a heated argument with a teammate. This incident adds to Shaw's past controversies. Fitness concerns have also affected his career. He was not picked in the IPL 2025 auction. Shaw has moved to Maharashtra for a fresh start.

description: László Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature 2025 for his compelling and visionary oeuvre. The Swedish Academy announced the prestigious award on Thursday. This year's literature prize joins announcements for Chemistry, Physics, and Medicine, recognizing significant scientific and artistic achievements.

title: China to India: 'Promise' that rare earth magnets supplied will not be re-exported to US
description: China has tightened rare earth export controls, restricting processing technology and targeting defense and semiconductor users. Beijing is reportedly seeking guarantees from India that its heavy rare earth magnets will not be re-exported to the US, aiming to use these controls as a bargaining chip in trade talks.

What fear does to your brain and body
description: When startled, your brain and body activate the fight-or-flight response, flooding you with stress hormones. This rapid reaction, coordinated by the amygdala and hypothalamus, quickens breathing, raises heart rate, and sharpens senses for survival. While essential, chronic activation can harm health, but managing fear through mindfulness, exercise, and support is possible.

title: Nayanthara pens note of gratitude on completing 22 years in cinema: ‘Every frame, every shot, every silence shaped me’
Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
description: Google is reportedly tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, intended to prevent WFA from substituting regular hybrid work, has drawn criticism from employees for its confusing implementation and restrictions.

title: India-UK CEO Forum: PM Modi, Starmer chart 'roadmap for shared progress'
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK PM Keir Starmer addressed the India-UK CEO Forum, highlighting the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and its potential to double bilateral trade to $112 billion by 2030. The leaders emphasized CETA's role in enhancing market access, strengthening MSMEs, and fostering collaboration in commerce, education, technology, and aspirations, building on existing strong economic ties.

title: 1st in India! K'taka approves 12 menstrual leaves a year; what policy says
description: Karnataka has become India's first state to approve menstrual leave for women, allowing up to 12 sanctioned leaves annually. State minister Santosh Lad announced the progressive law, emphasizing its welfare-oriented approach for women. The decision marks a significant step for women's rights in the state.

description: Pakistan-based terror group Jaish-e-Mohammed has launched its first women's wing, 'Jamaat-ul-Mominaat,' led by Maulana Masood Azhar's sister. Recruitment targets wives of commanders and vulnerable women. This strategic shift, possibly prompted by recent attacks and Indian Army operations, signals a potential move towards training female suicide attackers, aligning JeM with other groups that have utilized women in combat roles.

Was Ashwin 'forced' into retirement by Rohit, Gautam Gambhir?
description: Ravichandran Ashwin clarified his retirement from cricket was a personal choice, not influenced by selectors or teammates, despite advice to reconsider. He emphasized the need for clear communication between senior players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli and team management regarding their future roles and the 2027 World Cup.

title: India needs a national mission for urban roads

To ease Diwali rush near markets, Chandigarh Traffic Police identify alternative parking sites. Check details
Education of Nobel Peace Prize-winning US presidents
description: US President Donald Trump has been nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize amid international endorsements. This article explores the educational backgrounds of the four American presidents who previously won the Nobel Peace Prize: Theodore Roosevelt, Woodrow Wilson, Jimmy Carter, and Barack Obama. It details their academic achievements, presidential tenures, reasons for receiving the prize, and current status, highlighting their diverse educational journeys from Harvard and Princeton to the US Naval Academy and beyond.

title: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu sends ‘Thank You’ message to Amit Shah; dedicates it to engineers
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has switched to Zoho Mail, India's homegrown email platform, a move celebrated by Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu. This decision aligns with the government's push for digital sovereignty and boosts the adoption of Indian tech solutions. Shah's endorsement signifies a growing confidence in the nation's indigenous digital infrastructure.

title: Boost for Indian students: UK to open 9 university campuses in India
description: India and the United Kingdom are strengthening their educational partnership. Nine British universities will soon open campuses in India. This collaboration aims to provide high-quality higher education. It is expected to create thousands of skilled jobs. This move signifies a major expansion in bilateral education cooperation. Both nations anticipate significant growth and enhanced opportunities.

title: Inside Coldrif plant: Rusty equipment among 364 violations found; deadly lapses exposed
description: Madhya Pradesh police arrested Sresan Pharmaceuticals owner G Ranganathan, 73, in Chennai after his cough syrup, Coldrif, was linked to 21 child deaths due to toxic chemicals. The company, despite operating with numerous violations for years, is now under national scrutiny, with its manufacturing unit sealed.

title: McDavid faces backlash for blunt comments on young players after extension
description: Connor McDavid has signed a two-year, $25 million extension with the Edmonton Oilers, accepting below-market value to prioritize winning now.  His decision reflects the team's limited youth due to past trades, creating a tight window for a Stanley Cup.  General Manager Stan Bowman highlighted McDavid's team-first approach, emphasizing the immediate goal of championship contention.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: Wife claims husband faced 'years of humiliation'; mystery note in focus
description: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, IAS officer Amneet P Kumar, has lodged a complaint seeking FIR against Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur and Rohtak SP Narendra Bijarnia for abetment to suicide and SC/ST Act violations. She alleges her husband faced systematic persecution and humiliation due to his caste, pushing him to suicide.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s former Manhattan townhouse lists for $17M after 20 years
description: Gisele Bundchen's former New York City home is now for sale. The elegant townhouse in Manhattan's West Village is listed at $16.995 million. Bundchen owned the property about 20 years ago. The historic home offers refined living space and modern amenities. This property represents a piece of supermodel history in a sought-after neighborhood.

title: Trade war heats up: US targets Chinese tech firms; Beijing vows ‘necessary measures’
description: The Trump administration has expanded export restrictions to include subsidiaries of Chinese tech companies on the entity list, aiming to close loopholes. This move targets firms like Huawei and DJI, impacting tens of thousands of entities and drawing sharp condemnation from Beijing as US-China tech tensions escalate.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in Abercrombie NFL collection; Randi cheers
description: Brittany Mahomes has launched a stylish new NFL apparel line with Abercrombie & Fitch, showcasing custom Kansas City Chiefs outfits. The collaboration, shot at Arrowhead Stadium, highlights her entrepreneurial spirit and family pride, earning praise from fans and mother-in-law Randi Mahomes. This venture comes as the Chiefs navigate a challenging season, with Brittany encouraging fans to support the team.
